required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of the Safety and Efficacy of FID 120947A

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of FID 120947A in soft contact lens wearers of Japanese ethnicity. This study will be conducted in Japan.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eyes With Visibly Clean Lenses at each visit
primary_outcome.description: Worn study lenses will be removed and evaluated for deposits. Deposits found on the lenses will be defined using a 3-part classification system consisting of general visibility, the specific appearance and area covered.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eyes With Crystalline Deposits by Type at each visit
primary_outcome.description: Worn study lenses will be removed and evaluated for deposits. Deposits found on the lenses will be defined using a 3-part classification system consisting of general visibility, the specific appearance and area covered.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eyes With Film Deposits by Type at each visit
primary_outcome.description: Worn study lenses will be removed and evaluated for deposits. Deposits found on the lenses will be defined using a 3-part classification system consisting of general visibility, the specific appearance and area covered.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Eyes With Change From Baseline in Contact Lens-Corrected Distance Visual Acuity (CLCDVA) by Line Change at each visit
primary_outcome.description: Distance visual acuity (VA) will be measured using Snellen charts.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Lens Wear Time (averaged over the last 3 days) at each visit
primary_outcome.description: Subject will record a response to the question, "Averaging over the last 3 days, how many hours per day did you wear your contact lenses?"

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Unscheduled Lens Replacements by Reason
Likert Item - "When I Use This Solution, my Lenses Are Comfortable All Day."
primary_outcome.description: Subject will select a single response (Strongly Agree, Agree, Undecided, Disagree, Strongly Disagree) to best describe their lens wearing experience over the last 3 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Likert Item - "When I Use This Solution, at the End of the Lens Wearing Day my Vision is Clear."
primary_outcome.description: Subject will select a single response (Strongly Agree, Agree, Undecided, Disagree, Strongly Disagree) to best describe their lens wearing experience over the last 3 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Likert Item - "When I Use This Solution, I Like the Way This Product Feels During Handling."
primary_outcome.description: Subject will select a single response (Strongly Agree, Agree, Undecided, Disagree, Strongly Disagree) to best describe their lens wearing experience over the last 3 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Crystalline Deposit Area Covered at each visit
primary_outcome.description: Worn study lenses will be removed and evaluated for deposits. Deposits found on the lenses will be defined using a 3-part classification system consisting of general visibility, the specific appearance and area covered.

primary_outcome.measure: Film Deposit Area Covered at each visit
primary_outcome.description: Worn study lenses will be removed and evaluated for deposits. Deposits found on the lenses will be defined using a 3-part classification system consisting of general visibility, the specific appearance and area covered.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Rewetting Drop Frequency at each visit
primary_outcome.description: Subject will record a response to the question, "Averaging over the last 3 days, how many times per day did you use rewetting drops?"

primary_outcome.measure: Lens Wear Time at each visit day
primary_outcome.description: Subject will record a response to the question, "How many hours have you worn your contact lenses today?"

arm_group.description: FID 120947A contact lens disinfecting solution used with soft contact lenses (study lenses) on a daily basis for 180 days. SCL preservative solution used standard-of-care.

intervention.description: Investigational 3% hydrogen peroxide solution that uses a platinum catalyst for neutralization and is intended for simultaneous cleaning, protein removal, disinfecting and storage of silicone hydrogel and soft contact lenses

Commercially available soft contact lenses worn a minimum of 8 hours each day on a daily wear basis for the duration of the study (180 days). A fresh pair will be dispensed on Day 0, Day 30, Day 60, and Day 135.
Commercially available solution for rinsing soft contact lenses

facility.name: Contact Alcon Japan, Ltd. for Trial Locations
